intro: Sphalmanthus scintillans, commonly known as the sparkling bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and distinctive pod fruits. The plant is notable for its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Sphalmanthus scintillans is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
